title: The Fork in the Road
story: Sometimes you need to handle both paths - what happens when a condition is true AND what happens when it's false. The if-else statement gives you complete control over both scenarios!
instructions: Create a variable `age` with value 16. Use an if-else statement: if age is >= 18, print "You can vote!". Otherwise, print "Too young to vote". Your code should handle both cases.

tests.expectedBehavior: Since age < 18, should print else branch

hints.text: The else clause handles what happens when the if condition is false
Structure: if condition: (action1) else: (action2). Both actions need indentation
if age >= 18: print("You can vote!") else: print("Too young to vote")
